title: Les Frères Perroud 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Brouilly)
description: A bright and juicy wine from this often easygoing appellation. The red-cherry fruitiness and attractive acidity make for a wine that is rounded and ripe. It is ready to drink, crisp and fruity at the end.

title: McManis 2015 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Fresh green-apple aromas and crisp, lemony flavors make this light-bodied wine appetizing and fresh.

title: La Quercia 2015  Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
description: Here's a solid, straightforward red that opens with aromas of sour cherry and a whiff of new leather. The ripe fruity palate exhibits juicy blackberry, raspberry and a hint of anise. It's easy drinking, with soft tannins.

title: Obalo 2015 Rosado (Rioja)
description: Aromas of peach pit and dry melon are firm and clean but nothing special. This feels fresh and correct, nothing more. Pithy briny stone-fruit flavors are steady on the finish, which shows good weight and balance. Drink now.

title: Quinta de Porrais 2014 Porrais Red (Douro)
description: A classic Douro blend that includes Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca has produced a ripe, soft and full wine. It has licorice and dark-chocolate flavors as well as bold tannins and rich black-currant fruits. Drink this solid wine from 2018.

title: Quinta do Castelinho 2013 Reserva Red (Douro)
description: This is a ripe, smooth wine. With spice from wood aging and balanced acidity, it is fruity as well as lightly structured. Drink now.

title: Quinta do Portal 2014 Colheita Red (Douro)
description: Initially austere, this is a strongly tannic wine with a firm structure and lean fruits. It is still young and the tannins should soften. Drink from 2020.

title: Quinta dos Avidagos 2012 Premium Red (Douro)
description: This is a balanced, ripe wine. Soft tannins support the fruit well, offering some good potential. It is ready to drink, fruity and with acidity in the aftertaste.

title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2013 Reserva Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)
description: This wine has tannins, a dense structure and concentration. Still firm, it offers wood-aging flavors as well as big black fruits. Drink this wine from 2018.

title: Sierra Starr 2013 Super Nova Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)
description: Very dry, very firm and not too full bodied, this wine needs time in the cellar to mellow. It has overripe prune and plum aromas, dense blackberry and dark-chocolate flavors and an almost stiff, gripping feel on the palate. Best after 2020.

title: Vinaceous 2014 Shakré Chardonnay (Margaret River)
description: Showing some appealing, toasted-marshmallow oak, this is a medium-bodied, silky-textured wine. Melony fruit provides flesh, while hints of citrus and scorched coffee mark the finish. Drink now.

title: Weisinger 2015 Gold Vineyard Chardonnay (Rogue Valley)
description: Smooth and lightly buttery, this enjoyable single vineyard wine offers appealing flavors of apple and caramel. The finish is creamy and generous, with just a touch of heat.

title: Tahbilk 2015 Estate Grown and Bottled Viognier (Nagambie Lakes)
description: Despite ample alcohol, this Viognier comes across as less than fully ripe, offering up spicy, herb-inflected notes of nectarine and grapefruit. It fits the house style of restrained fruit and should prove more ageworthy and versatile with food than many Viogniers.

title: Campolargo 2012 Entre II Santos Red (Bairrada)
description: This light and fruity wine has 80% Baga in its blend. It is juicy, full of acidity and bright with red-berry fruitiness. The wine is immediately attractive and ready to drink.

title: Château Meillier 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: Some wood aging has given this wine its smooth texture and light eucalyptus character. It has also give the fruit extra richness and depth. The black-currant flavors are rich, lifted by balanced acidity. This is going to be a delicious wine from early 2017.

title: Château Puy Rigaud 2015  Montagne-Saint-Émilion
description: The vineyards of this estate take their name from their hillside (Puy) position. The wine is still very young with its generous black fruits and acidity still bubbling with energy. With tannins in the background, it will be a wine that develops relatively quickly, certainly ready to drink by 2019.

title: Château Roc de Boissac 2012 Château la Croix  (Lalande de Pomerol)
description: This is a bold and ripe wine from the gravel soil of Lalande de Pomerol. It is now reaching maturity. It has rich blackberry fruits, layered with acidity. The tannic core is still firm giving the wine the chance to age further. Drink until 2022.

title: Château Vrai Caillou 2014  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: This ripe blackberry-flavored wine is deliciously ready to drink. It has soft tannins and a smooth texture that is now just right. The acidity and the jammy aftertaste make the wine attractive.

title: Cliff Creek 2011 Sams Valley Vineyard Syrah (Southern Oregon)
description: This is a late release wine, but a bit of a boon for wine drinkers, who may open and consume it at will. Light cranberry, licorice, root beer and coffee flavors meld, with plenty of supporting acidity. It's a modest wine, with a quick finish, but drinks nicely at the moment.

title: College Cellars 2014 Clarke Vineyard Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Barrel aromas are out front, with notes of char, toast and vanilla along with dark raspberry and spice. The palate presents a mixture of fruit and barrel, with the latter showing a bit too prominently.

title: Collina San Ponzio 2012 Fossati  (Barolo)
description: Dried violet, mature berry and leather aromas lead the way. The straightforward palate shows dried cherry, chopped herb and a hint of licorice alongside grainy tannins that leave an astringent finish.

title: Conceito Vinhos 2014 Contraste Tinto Red (Douro)
description: Red-berry fruits dominate this still-young wine that has dark tannins and concentration. Spice and wood-aging flavors still show strongly. Drink from 2019.

title: Coteaux da Murta NV Murta Extra Brut Rosé Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)
description: Made from 100% Touriga Nacional, this is a dark-pink-colored rosé. The fruit is full while also crisp. Extra Brut suggests a dry wine, although in fact the ripeness of the fruit means it is soft and full. This sparkling wine is ready to drink.

title: CVNE 2014 Viña Real Barrel Fermented Viura (Rioja)
description: Candle wax, a touch of yeast and early oxidized aromas control the nose on this barrel-fermented Viura. Quick apple flavors turn lightly bitter, buttery and yeasty in front of a lasting, dry finish.

title: Cellers Unió 2015 Clos Dalian Garnacha Blanca (Terra Alta)
description: Light peach and grape-skin aromas lead to a zesty citrusy palate that's slightly oily in feel. Flavors of orange, tangerine and stone-fruit pits finish firm, steady and a touch salty.

title: Château Beauséjour 2014  Fronsac
description: This fruity wine is young and full of black-currant flavors. The wine still has a stalky character that will soften. This is going to be a crisp while also structured wine. Drink from 2018.

title: Château Corbin 2011 Divin de Corbin  (Saint-Émilion)
description: Still full of tannins, this is a tight strongly textured wine. It is dry, just hinting at black fruits and juicy acidity. It is probably already aged and so will remain a firm wine with fruit flavors in the background.

title: Château Crusquet de Lagarcie 2011  Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux
description: The wine has some maturity although its tannins are still very present. It has some juicy black-currant flavor that is shot through with the dry core. The aftertaste brings out more acidity and a more juicy character. Drink from 2018.

title: 3 Horse Ranch Vineyards 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)
description: Cocoa, bittersweet chocolate, herb, wood spice and cherry aromas lead to lightly styled cherry and cola flavors. The tannins bring a tacky feel.

title: Antonio Gonzalez 2013 Don Antonio Grand Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Plum, berry and clay aromas come across as reduced. This feels big and a bit clumsy, with grabby tannins. Candied medicinal plum flavors are reedy and mildly green at the core, while this tastes of chocolate, freshly cut grass and cherry cough drop on a tannic finish.
